Package application.Model

Class PlannerModel

java.lang.Object
application.Model.PlannerModel
public class PlannerModel
extends java.lang.Object
PlannerModel is the model class for PlannerController to call upon following VMC Guidelines

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    PlannerModel()  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    static void addEvent​(java.lang.String date, java.lang.String string, java.lang.String time, java.lang.String details)
    addEvent writes to "taskData.txt" based off user input task and time, and then calls printDay to refresh the task view for the newly added task
    static void deleteEvent​(java.lang.String event, java.lang.String date, java.lang.String string)
    deleteEvent deletes and event from "taskData.txt" by reading over the given file and writing to a temporary file, before then deleting temp file and renaming it to the original file name
    static java.lang.String printDay​(java.lang.String date, java.lang.String string)
    printDay reads the "taskData.txt" file and returns a string of what is to be read from the user selected date
    static java.lang.String scheduleEvent​(java.lang.String time, java.lang.String details)
    scheduleEvent is a method addEvent calls upon to format the passed time and task details to be used in writing to "taskData.txt"
    static java.lang.String setDay​(java.lang.String date)
    method to return the day of week from calendar input

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • PlannerModel

      public PlannerModel()

  • Method Details

    • setDay

      public static java.lang.String setDay​(java.lang.String date)
      method to return the day of week from calendar input
      Parameters:
      date - date passed from user selection
      Returns:
      the day of week to be returned ex. MONDAY

    • printDay

      public static java.lang.String printDay​(java.lang.String date, java.lang.String string)
      printDay reads the "taskData.txt" file and returns a string of what is to be read from the user selected date
      Parameters:
      date - date to be used
      string - file name
      Returns:
      string of tasks to be returned

    • addEvent

      public static void addEvent​(java.lang.String date, java.lang.String string, java.lang.String time, java.lang.String details)
      addEvent writes to "taskData.txt" based off user input task and time, and then calls printDay to refresh the task view for the newly added task
      Parameters:
      date - date passed from user
      string - file name
      time - time the task should be done at
      details - details of the task

    • deleteEvent

      public static void deleteEvent​(java.lang.String event, java.lang.String date, java.lang.String string) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException, java.io.IOException
      deleteEvent deletes and event from "taskData.txt" by reading over the given file and writing to a temporary file, before then deleting temp file and renaming it to the original file name
      Parameters:
      event - task in formatted string to be deleted
      date - date on which the task will be deleted
      string - file name
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException
      java.io.IOException

    • scheduleEvent

      public static java.lang.String scheduleEvent​(java.lang.String time, java.lang.String details)
      scheduleEvent is a method addEvent calls upon to format the passed time and task details to be used in writing to "taskData.txt"
      Parameters:
      time - time from user
      details - details of task from user
      Returns:
      return formatted version of the task event ex. '00:00 do stuff'
